resources.string: Kontakt SDK Samples
This sample runs basic iBeacon and Eddystone foreground scanning and displays results as logs in Android Studio logcat.\n\nCheck BeaconEddystoneScanActivity.class for implementation.

Beacon Pro devices, additionally to non-connectable iBeacon and Eddystone frames, also broadcast a 3rd frame called 'Secure Profile frame'.

 This frame is used to connect with Beacon Pro to change its properties. It also contains device's Unique ID and Mac address which are not available in iBeacon/Eddystone frames as they were in Smart and Card beacons case.

 This sample scans specifically for Secure Profile frames and displays results as logs in Android Studio logcat.

Check BeaconProScanActivity class for implementation.

This sample showcases reading light sensor data from a Beacon Pro device.

 We scan for a Beacon Pro with a given Unique ID, connect, authorize and subscribe for a light sensor data. 

Check BeaconProSensorsActivity class for implementation.

This sample runs basic iBeacon and Eddystone foreground scanning and utilizes regions/namespaces option of ProximityManager.\n\n Go to ScanRegionsActivity class to see implementation and set your own regions.

This sample runs basic iBeacon and Eddystone foreground scanning and utilizes filters option of ProximityManager. Results are displayed as logs in Android Studio logcat. 

IBeacons with major and minor values higher than 100 will be omitted. Only Eddystones with URL that contains word 'google' will be reported. 

Check ScanFiltersActivity class for implementation.

This sample runs basic iBeacon scanning. Also, the sample features how it is possible to use KontaktScanFilters and proximityManager.setForegroundNotification(). This sample has a side effect of showing a foreground notification. Results are displayed as logs in Android Studio logcat. Every time you pause the screen, the scan is not affected for iBeacons. Try comparing the results when you comment out the code line indicated by TODO marker. \n\nCheck AndroidAbove8ScanWithPausedScreen class for implementation.

This sample presents how one can achieve a background scanning using Android's Service

 Service will run for 30 seconds and terminate itself after.

 During the scan a broadcast is sent whenever a device is discovered. Activity is registered for those broadcasts and displays scanning results.

 Check BackgroundScanActivity class for implementation.

This sample presents how to achieve beacons scanning using Android's Foreground Service

 Service will run until user stops it explicitly by clicking stop button. Beacons will be scanned even if app is not in the foreground.

 During the scan a broadcast is sent whenever a device is discovered. Activity is registered for those broadcasts and displays scanning results.

 Check ForegroundScanActivity class for implementation.

This sample provides an example of changing Beacon's configuration (major and minor in this case).
Beacon needs to have a firmware version 4.0 or higher or be a Beacon Pro.

 Firstly, proximity manager will scan for a device with given unique ID, create configuration object, acquire encrypted version from the Kontakt Cloud, apply it on the device and send the results back to the Cloud to stay synchronized.

 Check BeaconConfigurationActivity class for implementation.

This sample provides an example of communicating with Kontakt.io Cloud using KontaktCloud object.

 These sample requests allow you to:
- fetch list of your devices,
- fetch list of current pending configurations,
- fetch account managers details.

 Check KontaktCloudActivity class for implementation.

This sample provides an example of communicating with Kontakt.io Cloud using KontaktCloud object and executeSuspending() invocations.

 These sample requests allow you to:
- fetch list of your devices,
- fetch list of current pending configurations,
- fetch account managers details.

 Check KontaktCloudWithCoroutinesActivity class for implementation.
